description: Authoritative research on liberal arts value, career outcomes, employer demand, and the AI era. Used to support student questions about the value of their degree.
usage: Cite by title and link. Do not paraphrase claims â€” direct students to the source.

ai-era.name: Liberal Arts in the AI Age
ai-era.description: Research on how liberal arts skills relate to AI, automation, and the future of work

sources.title: The Future of Jobs Report 2025
sources.note: 1,000+ employers surveyed; 39% of key skills will change by 2030; analytical thinking, creative thinking, resilience rank alongside AI as top rising skills

sources.title: AI Index Report 2025
sources.note: Annual report tracking AI across economy, education, and policy; 78% of organizations used AI in 2024

sources.title: A New Direction for Students in an AI World: Prosper, Prepare, Protect
sources.note: Global study across 50+ countries on student development in the AI age

sources.title: New Future of Work Report 2025
sources.note: Finds AI shifts work from 'doing' to 'choosing'; warns workers risk losing planning, judgment, and domain expertise without training

sources.title: Incorporating AI Impacts in BLS Employment Projections
sources.note: Official U.S. government analysis of AI impact on 2023-2033 employment projections

sources.title: Bridging the AI Skills Gap: Is Training Keeping Up?
sources.note: Most workers exposed to AI need general AI literacy, not specialist skills; current training skewed toward AI professionals

sources.title: The Human Advantage: Stronger Brains in the Age of AI
sources.source: World Economic Forum / McKinsey Health Institute
sources.note: Makes the case that brain capital (critical thinking, creativity, empathy) is the strategic foundation for competitiveness in the AI age

sources.title: Workers and AI Research Collection
sources.note: 30%+ of workers could see 50%+ of tasks affected by generative AI; unlike previous automation, AI disrupts cognitive and non-routine tasks

perspective.name: Perspectives & Commentary
perspective.description: Opinion pieces and debates about liberal arts value

sources.title: The Hidden Utility of the Liberal Arts
It's time to stop worshipping the liberal arts
sources.note: Skeptical perspective - useful for acknowledging counterarguments

sources.title: Liberal arts and critical thinking (letters)
